title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: Reshuffling all 32 teams after the draft
content: Our panel of experts ranked every NFL team from 1 to 32. Which franchises improved with their draft picks and offseason moves?

title: NFL experts debate the draft: What were the best -- and most puzzling -- picks?
content: Great value on Malaki Starks? Reach on Isaac TeSlaa? We asked 17 experts to weigh in on the NFL draft.

title: Sources: 2-game ban expected for U-M's Moore
content: Michigan football coach Sherrone Moore is expected to be suspended for two games for the upcoming 2025 season as part of self-imposed sanctions by the university for the Connor Stalions advanced scouting scandal, industry sources told ESPN.

title: Pop 'getting better,' but time to pass Spurs' torch
content: Gregg Popovich spoke publicly for the first time since his stroke, saying he's "getting better by the day" but that "it's time" for Mitch Johnson to be the Spurs' coach.

title: Browns LB Bush arrested, charged with assault
content: Browns linebacker Devin Bush has been arrested and charged with simple assault and harassment in Pennsylvania, according to court records.

title: Jazz, coach Hardy agree to extension through '31
content: The Jazz and coach Will Hardy, who has an 85-161 record in his three seasons with Utah, have agreed to a multiyear extension through 2031, owner Ryan Smith said.

title: Gruden joins arena team as part-owner, adviser
content: Jon Gruden joined the Nashville Kats of the Arena Football One League as a part-owner and in what the club called "consulting and advisory roles in all aspects of the team's football and business operations."

title: IOC replaces Hall's 10 medals lost in L.A. fires
content: Five-time Olympic swimming champion Gary Hall Jr. received replicas of his 10 medals from the Games on Monday after the originals were destroyed during the Los Angeles wildfires in January.

title: Which NBA superstars lead our first playoff MVP rankings? We’re stacking the top 10
content: Who has dominated the postseason thus far? Chris Herring unveils his top 10 playoff MVPs, a list packed with star power and surprises.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Round 2 begins with Maple Leafs-Panthers Game 1
content: The 16-team playoff field has been cut in half. Here's what to watch next, along with three stars of Round 1.

title: PM Modi Chairs Key Meetings As India Prepares Pahalgam Response: 10 Points
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a series of key meetings this evening as India calibrated its response to the massive terror strike in Kashmir's Pahalgam. Russia has offered "full support" to India in its battle against terrorism.

title: "Some Social Media Influencers Acting Against India": House Panel To Centre
content: Parliament panel seeks details of action taken against social platforms working against "national interest" post J&K attack

title: Man Rams Car Into Pole, Hits 7 Vehicles In Attempt To Escape Cops In Mumbai
content: Panicked after his car rammed into an iron pole in Mulund area of Mumbai, a 26-year-old driver led police on a nearly 11-km chase on a highway.

title: Opinion: Opinion: Spain's Huge Power Blackout Is A Wake-Up Call For India
content: Politicians in New Delhi have correctly noted that solar and wind power meet three requirements they view as crucial.

title: Bride-To-Be Dies Of Cardiac Arrest While Dancing During 'Haldi' Ceremony
content: A 22-year-old bride-to-be died of cardiac arrest a day before her wedding here, police said on Monday.

title: Amit Shah Chairs Meet To Review Implementation Of 3 New Criminal Laws In Delhi
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah chaired a high-level review meeting over the implementation of three new criminal laws, in Delhi, at the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) in the national capital on Monday.

title: Centre Asks For Security Drills In States Amid J&K Tensions, First Since 1971
content: The Centre has asked several states to conduct security mock drills on Wednesday, May 7, for "effective civil defence" amid tensions between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack on April 22, sources told NDTV.

title: BJP's Sambit Patra Meets Party MLAs, Ex Chief Minister In Manipur
content: The BJP's northeast in-charge Sambit Patra has reached Manipur and after a series of meetings, invited BJP MLAs for a meeting at the City hotel, sparking speculation about fresh efforts at government formation, sources said.

title: 2 Arrested For Asking Candidate To Remove 'Sacred Thread' At NEET Exam Centre
content: Two people were arrested in connection with an incident where a candidate was allegedly asked to remove "janivara" (sacred thread worn by Brahmins) before entering the exam hall to appear for the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) on May 4

title: "Mindset Must Change": Top Court Orders Admission Of Disabled Candidate In AIIMS
content: Observing that systemic discrimination against persons with benchmark disabilities should be eliminated, the Supreme Court has directed the allocation of a seat to a candidate with disability who cleared the MBBS entrance exam in 2024.

title: What's A US Real ID? How To Get One As Deadline Looms
content: The deadline to get a REAL ID is fast approaching after years of postponements and delays. Starting May 7, your license or identification card will need to be REAL ID-compliant to fly domestically in the U.S.

title: UP Teen, Out To Buy Vegetables, Kidnapped, Raped For Days; 1 Arrested
content: On the pretext of asking for an address, the man kidnapped a 13-year-old girl and allegedly took her to the hotel.

title: "Won't Give Single Drop Of Water To Haryana": Punjab Assembly Passes Resolution
content: The Punjab Assembly on Monday unanimously passed a resolution, vowing not to spare even a single drop of water from its share to Haryana.

title: SGA, Nikola Jokic and why this should be an epic, polite MVP clash
content: Both players have had historic, unprecedented seasons. Gilgeous-Alexander could win his first MVP, Jokic his fourth -- but neither is keen to campaign for it.

title: A.J. Brown's proposal to girlfriend includes performance by John Legend
content: The Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver will don his second ring in a several month stretch after helping the Eagles win Super Bowl LIX in February.

title: Chelsea-Liverpool lessons, Napoli close to Serie A title, Bayern clinch Bundesliga, more
content: Chelsea beat Liverpool, Napoli moved closer to another Serie A title, and Bayern Munich clinched the Bundesliga without playing: Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Sources: Madrid want Alexander-Arnold for CWC
content: Real Madrid want Trent Alexander-Arnold to join them for this summer's Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN, and now plan talks with Liverpool to negotiate his early release.

title: Kane targets trophy 'number two' after title win
content: England striker Harry Kane said it feels sweet to finally end his career-long trophy drought after securing the Bundesliga title with Bayern Munich

title: Mourinho silent on future as Fener title hopes fade
content: José Mourinho refused to confirm whether he will remain at Fenerbahce next season after Sunday's defeat to Besiktas left them adrift in the title race.

title: Kroos: Pedri 'more important' to Barça than Yamal
content: Former Real Madrid player Toni Kroos believes Barcelona's Pedri is the best midfielder in the world and more important to his team than Lamine Yamal, Robert Lewandowski and Raphinha.

title: Mac Allister: Liverpool 'just getting started'
content: Liverpool midfielder Alexis Mac Allister hopes winning the Premier League title this season is "just the beginning of something great."

title: CAS to rule in León's Club World Cup dispute
content: A verdict is expected Tuesday in Liga MX club León's legal dispute with FIFA over entry to the Club World Cup in the United States next month.

title: Inzaghi: Inter must stop Yamal to reach final
content: Intern Milan coach Simone Inzaghi said his side must stop quick thinker Lamine Yamal if they are to reach the Champions League final.

title: Palmer hits back at online 'idiots' as Chelsea win
content: Cole Palmer hit back at social media "idiots" after ending his goal drought in Chelsea's 3-1 win over Liverpool on Sunday.

title: Miami GP showcases F1's youth movement, American popularity
content: From the drivers in the cars to the fans in the stands, young people made F1's Miami GP yet another success.

title: Lufthansa To Emirates: International Airlines Shun Pakistan Airspace Amid India Tensions
content: Amid increasing tension between New Delhi and Islamabad following a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, several international airlines are avoiding Pakistani airspace, according to airlines' statements and flight tracker data.

title: How Poonam Singh Defended Bhuttewala Chowk During 1965 Indo-Pak War
content: As tensions remains heightened between India and Pakistan following the deadly Pahalgam attack in Jammu and Kashmir, people remember the sacrifice of Poonam Singh, an Indian soldier who managed to hold off 60 Pakistani rangers during the 1965 war.

title: Rahul Gandhi At PM Modi's Office For Meeting On New CBI Chief
content: Rahul Gandhi has arrived at Prime Minister Narendra Modi's office for a meeting on the new CBI chief.

title: Indian-Origin UC Berkeley Student Paralysed After Fall At Frat House Party
content: A 21-year-old Indian-origin, who was just weeks away from graduating from the University of California, Berkeley, was paralysed from the waist down after falling from a balcony at a fraternity house party in April.

title: Karnataka Begins Survey Of Scheduled Castes To Collect Empirical Data
content: A survey on SC sub-classification in the state has begun and will go on till May 17, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said on Monday.

title: IIITDM Jabalpur Student Films Roommate In Hostel Bathroom, Detained: Cops
content: A B Tech student at prestigious IIITDM Jabalpur in Madhya Pradesh was detained by police on Monday for allegedly filming her senior roommate in the hostel's bathroom, officials said.

title: 311 To Be Unified Helpline Number For Civic Complaints: Delhi Minister
content: Delhi PWD Minister Parvesh Verma on Monday said that the government is close to adopting unified helpline number '311' for registration of civic complaints related to NDMC, MCD, DDA, Jal Board and public works and flood control departments.

title: Inoue won the weekend and proved once again he's must-see TV
content: Naoya "The Monster" Inoue delivered another successful and entertaining performance when boxing needed it most.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers, Stars are favorites to hoist Cup
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Kirst, Kavanagh or English? Paul Carcaterra's big board for the 2025 PLL draft
content: ESPN's Paul Carcaterra ranks the 2025 PLL draft's top prospects and matches teams up with players who best fit their needs.

title: Rankings, projections, strategy and cheat sheets
content: Rankings, projections, player profiles, draft strategies -- we've got everything you need to dominate your fantasy women's basketball draft from every angle.

title: Waiver wire: Why settle for one rising star when you can have two?
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and who you should be dropping from fantasy rosters.

title: MLS: Vancouver remain top; Seattle, Philadelphia soar up
content: The Vancouver Whitecaps continue to dominate the top spot in the latest edition of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Man City battle for Rodrygo
content: Arsenal and Manchester City are both interested in signing Real Madrid forward Rodrygo. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Real blow to Pakistan! India chokes $500 million goods via third countries
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, India has banned all imports from Pakistan, including indirect routes via intermediary nations, postal services, and vessels. This action, triggered by national security concerns, aims to prevent Pakistani goods from entering India through circumvention.

title: India offers zero-for-zero tariffs on auto parts, steel from US: Report
content: India and the US are in trade talks, with India proposing zero-for-zero tariff arrangements on specific items like steel and pharmaceuticals, contingent on reciprocity and import volumes.

title: 'Training students ...': What May 7 civil defence mock drills will include
content: The ministry of home affairs on Monday instructed several states to conduct civil defence mock drills on Wednesday, May 7, to improve readiness for potential hostile attacks amid rising India-Pakistan tensions. These drills include activating air raid sirens, training civilians in civil defence, implementing blackout protocols, camouflaging infrastructure, and updating evacuation plans.

title: Ray Dalio says Donald Trump’s tariff war is pushing America close to a recession
content: Ray Dalio, who predicted the 2008 crisis, warns that mishandled economic policies, particularly Trump's tariffs, could push the U.S. into a recession. He likens the tariffs' disruptive implementation to destabilizing the production system. Despite a tariff pause, Goldman Sachs estimates a significant chance of a recession within the next year, highlighting growing economic uncertainty.

title: 'I will be the next Tendulkar': Virat Kohli’s teacher recalls his school days
content: Virat Kohli, a cricket legend, dreamt of emulating Sachin Tendulkar, revealed his childhood teacher Vibha Sachdev. Kohli balanced rigorous cricket practice with academics, often preparing for exams late due to training. Despite the challenges, teachers supported his dedication.

title: Bleeding with thousand cuts: Steps India has taken against Pak since Pahalgam
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, India has taken several actions against Pakistan. India suspended the Indus Waters Treaty and closed the Wagah-Attari border. Diplomatic ties were downgraded, and Pakistani diplomats were declared persona non grata. Visas for Pakistani nationals were revoked, and airspace was closed. Trade and shipping ties have been suspended.

title: SRH faces playoff elimination if match ends in no result
content: Delhi Capitals struggled to 134 against Sunrisers Hyderabad after a disastrous start, recovering from 29/5 thanks to Ashutosh Sharma and Tristan Stubbs. Pat Cummins' fiery spell dismantled Delhi's top order, taking three wickets in the powerplay. Rain arrived immediately after the first innings, jeopardizing SRH's playoff chances and potentially impacting Delhi Capitals' IPL 2025 aspirations.

title: Elon Musk is no longer ‘Elon Musk’ on Twitter; changes his profile name to…
content: Elon Musk has once again altered his X display name, this time to 'Gorklon Rust,' sparking speculation about its meaning. The moniker appears to blend references to Grok, Musk's AI chatbot, and the Rust programming language, potentially linked to xAI's infrastructure.

title: Trump within his rights to negotiate tariffs, India capable of working out deal: Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi stated that India is capable of negotiating a fair trade deal with the US, acknowledging President Trump's right to adjust tariff structures. Speaking at Brown University, Gandhi stressed India's need to develop a robust manufacturing sector to rival China, emphasizing the importance of a liberalized economy for social progress.

title: Rohit Sharma presents T20 World Cup winning ring to Mohammad Siraj
content: Rohit Sharma presented Mohammed Siraj with his T20 World Cup winning ring, as Siraj had missed the official ceremony during the BCCI's Naman Awards. Sharma acknowledged Siraj's vital role in India's victorious T20 campaign. The customized ring features the player's name, jersey number, and an Ashok Chakra, commemorating India's first major title since the 2013 Champions Trophy.

title: What Xi's Moscow visit won't show: The Chinese dying for Russia
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping will visit Russia soon. This visit occurs amidst reports of Chinese nationals fighting in Ukraine, mostly for Russia. Some fighters are returning with harrowing experiences. Ukraine accuses China of supplying Russia with war materials. China denies any state involvement. The situation poses a challenge for Xi, balancing support for Russia with avoiding direct military engagement.

title: 'Musk behaved badly. He gives ...,' says Putin's close ally Ramzan Kadyrov
content: Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov accused Elon Musk of remotely disabling a Cybertruck he claimed Musk gifted him, which Kadyrov had equipped with a machine gun for use in the SVO. Musk denied gifting the vehicle, raising questions about how Kadyrov obtained it, given US sanctions.

title: Watch: Kavya Maran's priceless reaction during SRH vs DC match
content: During the IPL 2025 match between Sunrisers Hyderabad and Delhi Capitals, Vipraj Nigam's run-out triggered a visible reaction from SRH owner Kavya Maran, quickly going viral. The dismissal occurred due to a miscommunication with Tristan Stubbs, ending Nigam's innings at 18 runs. Maran's expressive response was highlighted by Star Sports, emphasizing the excitement of the IPL playoffs race.

title: 'Did not want ...': Mughal emperor's 'heir' after SC rejects Red Fort plea
content: Sultana Begum, claiming to be Bahadur Shah Zafar's great-granddaughter-in-law, faced disappointment as the Supreme Court dismissed her plea for the Red Fort's possession. The court deemed her petition "completely misconceived," shattering her hopes. Begum, who sought her ancestral home, expressed distress, questioning her future.

title: India to become 4th largest economy in 2025, overtaking Japan
content: According to the IMF's World Economic Outlook April 2025, India is projected to become the fourth largest economy globally in 2025, surpassing Japan with a nominal GDP of $4,187.017 billion. The report indicates continued growth, forecasting India to overtake Germany by 2028 and achieve a $5 trillion economy by 2027.

title: India-Pak tensions hit skies as global airlines avoid Pakistani airspace
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and escalating India-Pakistan tensions, major airlines like Lufthansa and Air France are rerouting flights to avoid Pakistani airspace. This comes after India closed its airspace to Pakistani carriers. Pakistan faces lost overflight revenue as airlines opt for alternative routes via Delhi, despite increased fuel costs and flight time.

title: MI head coach Mahela Jayawardene opens up on Rohit Sharma's injury
content: Mumbai Indians head coach Mahela Jayawardene revealed that Rohit Sharma has been nursing a niggle since the Champions Trophy, explaining his usage as an impact substitute. Despite this, Sharma has scored 293 runs in 10 innings. MI, currently third with a strong Net Run Rate, needs two wins from their remaining three matches to secure a playoff spot.

title: New ITR-2 form notified: Top changes for taxpayers
content: The Central Board of Direct Taxes has released the updated ITR-2 form. It is for the assessment year 2025-26. The form includes separate reporting for capital gains. This is before and after July 23, 2024. Capital loss is allowed on share buybacks from October 1, 2024. The asset and liability reporting threshold is now Rupees one crore.

title: Delhi Capitals unleash 10.75 crore player for the first time this IPL
content: Delhi Capitals have included T Natarajan, their expensive acquisition, in the playing XI for the first time, replacing Mukesh Kumar to strengthen their death bowling. Sunrisers Hyderabad won the toss and chose to field first at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. Both captains emphasized the importance of executing their plans and maintaining a positive team environment as the league progresses.

title: Mohammed Shami faces death threat; FIR registered
content: Indian cricketer Mohammed Shami has received a death threat via email, prompting an FIR to be filed in Uttar Pradesh's Amroha district. The sender, identified as Rajput Sindar, allegedly demanded a ransom of Rs one crore. Shami is currently playing in the IPL 2025 for Sunrisers Hyderabad.

title: Stephen Curry shares message for teammates after Warriors beat Rockets
content: Stephen Curry's stellar performance propelled the Golden State Warriors to victory in Game 7 against the Houston Rockets. Curry scored 22 points, including 14 in the fourth quarter. Buddy Hield also contributed significantly with 33 points. The Warriors secured a 103-89 win. They now advance to face the Minnesota Timberwolves in the Western Conference Semi-Finals.

title: Pahalgam attackers must be brought to justice, Putin tells PM Modi
content: President Vladimir Putin conveyed his condolences to Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding the Pahalgam terror attack, assuring Russia's support in combating terrorism and emphasizing the need for justice. Both leaders affirmed their commitment to strengthening the India-Russia partnership.

title: 'Murshidabad violence was well planned,' claims Mamata; blames BSF & BJP
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee visited riot-affected Murshidabad, accusing the BJP-led Centre of instigating communal tensions. She alleged the BSF's actions escalated the violence and accused the BJP of forcibly relocating victims to prevent them from meeting her. Banerjee also criticized the NHRC's swift response to Murshidabad, questioning their absence in Manipur and Uttar Pradesh, suggesting a pre-planned conspiracy.

title: IPL 2025: Kagiso Rabada cleared to play, available for GT vs MI clash
content: South African fast bowler Kagiso Rabada is cleared to play again after completing a substance abuse treatment program. This followed a positive test for a recreational drug during the SA20 competition in January. SAIDS confirmed Rabada tested positive after a match on January 21 and was informed on April 1, leading to a provisional suspension.

title: CSK wicket-keeper ruled out of IPL 2025
content: Chennai Super Kings face a setback. Wicketkeeper Vansh Bedi is out of IPL 2025. Urvil Patel replaces him. Patel is a wicketkeeper-batter from Gujarat. He had strong domestic performances. CSK is already out of playoff contention. The team will focus on future rebuilding. Patel's addition offers a glimpse into the next generation. CSK will play final games with pride.

title: 'No help from government': MMA in Asian Games 2026 sparks concern
content: Mixed Martial Arts will debut at the 2026 Asian Games. India's athletes need government and sponsor support. Currently, there are no awards or government funding for training. India lacks a recognized federation to govern MMA. Ritu Phogat and Puja Tomar highlight the financial struggles. They emphasize the need for training centers and coaches.

title: Berkshire Hathaway board approves Greg Abel as CEO, backed by Warren Buffett
content: Berkshire Hathaway's board has officially named Greg Abel as the next CEO, succeeding Warren Buffett by the end of 2026. Abel, currently vice-chairman overseeing non-insurance operations, will navigate the $900 billion conglomerate through global economic challenges. Buffett, 94, will remain chairman to ensure continuity, expressing confidence in Abel's leadership to maintain Berkshire's success.

title: BSF plans to deploy 17K troops, set up HQs at Pak & B'desh borders
content: The Border Security Force is set to bolster its operational capabilities with 16 new battalions, adding approximately 17,000 personnel. This expansion follows initial approval and includes establishing forward headquarters for western and eastern commands, overseeing the Pakistan and Bangladesh borders. The move addresses heightened security concerns, particularly after political shifts in Bangladesh and recent terror attacks.

title: Pak has more to lose than India: Moody's big warning
content: Moody's Ratings warns that ongoing tensions with India pose a greater economic risk to Pakistan than to India. Pakistan's growth and fiscal consolidation could be hampered, straining foreign-exchange reserves. India's economy remains robust, with minimal impact expected.

title: Pahalgam attack: Pakistan test-fires 2nd missile as tensions rise
content: Amidst heightened tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack, Pakistan conducted a test flight of its home-made Fatah missile, capable of striking targets up to 120 kilometers. This launch, part of Exercise INDUS, aimed to validate the weapon's design and performance.

title: Post IWT suspension, India begins expanding reservoir capacity in J&K
content: Amid escalating India-Pakistan tensions, India is enhancing storage capacity at two Kashmir hydroelectric facilities, marking its first action outside the Indus Waters Treaty after suspending it. Maintenance operations, including reservoir flushing to remove sediment, were conducted at the Salal and Baglihar projects.

title: India A likely to leave for England on May 25, BCCI begin process
content: India A is set to tour England, with the first batch of players departing on May 25, as arranged by the BCCI. They will play three four-day games against England Lions, starting May 30, before the Test series. Senior players may participate in an unofficial Test for acclimatisation, depending on IPL progress and medical clearance.

title: SC lists PIL challenging Waqf case for hearing on May 15 by next CJI
content: The Supreme Court has scheduled a hearing on May 15, before a bench led by CJI-designate B R Gavai, to address petitions challenging the constitutionality of the Waqf Amendment Act, 2025. This decision follows the Centre's pause on key aspects of the law and assurances given to the court regarding waqf property denotification and appointments to the Central Waqf Council.

title: Shubman Gill being groomed for Test captaincy?
content: The Indian selection committee, led by Ajit Agarkar, is set to announce the squad for the England tour in May, with captaincy a key point of discussion. While Rohit Sharma's recent performance and Jasprit Bumrah's injury raise questions, the BCCI is considering Shubman Gill for a leadership role, potentially as vice-captain.

title: Prabhsimran bats for ailing father, undergoing dialysis thrice a week
content: Prabhsimran Singh's explosive batting for Punjab Kings in the IPL is a source of joy for his ailing father, Surjit Singh, who is battling kidney failure. Despite his health struggles, Surjit finds solace and happiness in watching his son's performance. Prabhsimran has produced 437 runs in 11 innings for PBKS at a strike rate of 170.

title: 'Aim to get publicity': SC rejects PIL seeking safety, security of tourists in J&K
content: The Supreme Court reprimanded a petitioner for filing a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) seeking tourist safety in hilly areas from terrorist attacks, deeming it a publicity stunt without genuine public concern. The court questioned the petitioner's motives and cautioned against demoralizing security forces with frivolous PILs, highlighting the judiciary's lack of expertise in terror investigation.

title: Arshdeep Singh: The left-arm quick India need in England
content: With his skill to swing the ball both ways and his dexterity to hit the 6m length consistently, Arshdeep Singh is arguably the best of his type India has had since Zaheer Khan. The 26-year-old's opening spell against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) is a gentle reminder to Ajit Agarkar and co. of why he should be on the plane for the five-match Test series against England, starting June 20.

title: ICC Rankings: India dominate white-ball formats, Australia top in Tests
content: India reigns supreme in ODI and T20I formats, securing the No. 1 spot in the latest ICC rankings, fueled by their Champions Trophy victory. New Zealand trails in ODIs, while Australia dominates the Test arena, despite a minor dip. England's Test resurgence propelled them to second, pushing India to fourth. The T20I rankings now encompass 100 teams, reflecting global participation.

title: Told not to honk, Thar driver drives over security guard in Delhi
content: The Delhi Police arrested 24-year-old Vijay alias Lale in a hit-and-run and attempt-to-murder case involving a security guard at Mahipalpur Flyover. The accused allegedly ran over the victim after an argument over honking. The victim sustained serious leg injuries. A Mahindra Thar, identified via CCTV, was seized, and the arrest was made within six hours of the incident.

title: Allahabad high court dismisses plea challenging Rahul Gandhi's citizenship
content: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a petition questioning Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's Indian citizenship. A BJP worker from Karnataka, S Vignesh Shishir, filed the petition. He alleged Gandhi possessed dual citizenship, making him ineligible to contest elections. The court had previously granted the Home Ministry time to verify information from the UK.

title: Israel 'unanimously approves' plan which includes Gaza 'conquest': Official
content: Israel has formulated a new plan for Gaza, reportedly involving the territory's conquest and potential relocation of its population southward for safety. The Israeli security cabinet, led by Prime Minister Netanyahu, has approved the plan, aiming to defeat Hamas and secure the release of hostages. While Israel considers humanitarian aid distribution, concerns persist regarding the blockade's impact on Gaza's 2.

title: Tribal girls’ insistence on reporting gang-rape brings attention, development to Naxal-hit village in Madhya Pradesh
content: Officials of the district administration, police officers, and politicians have been visiting the Duglai village in Madhya Pradesh’s Balaghat district every day since the crime was reported

title: Jairam Ramesh cites Dhankhar’s comments to take swipe at Modi
content: “If the same money is transferred directly to farmers, then each farmer household in India could receive at least ₹30,000 per year,” the RS Chairman said

title: Collective punishment is not how democratic society responds to tragedy: Mehbooba Mufti
content: PDP leader visits Pahalgam, calls for fair treatment of civilians and seeks financial help for pony wallas ahead of Amarnath yatra

title: Pahalgam terror attack: UN chief Guterres calls for ‘maximum restraint’
content: He says military solution is “no solution” to the India-Pakistan conflict, offers to help in any way to bring down tensions

title: BJP Northeast in-charge Sambit Patra meets Meitei and Kuki-Zo representatives in Manipur
content: Mr. Patra’s visit comes days after 21 Manipur Members of Legislative Assembly (MLA) wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah, urging them to form a “popular government” in the State

title: Allahabad High Court disposes of petition seeking CBI probe into Rahul Gandhi’s citizenship
content: The matter pertains to a plea filed by S. Vignesh Shishir, who had petitioned the court to order the CEC, the Chief Electoral Officer of Uttar Pradesh, and the Returning Officer of Raebareli to cancel the Congress leader’s electoral certificate

title: 3,000 SHG women to operate 700 Trupti canteens in State: MA&UD Minister
content: MA&UD Minister Ponguru Narayana inaugurates first Trupti Canteen in the state at Atmakur Bus Stand Centre in Nellore on Monday

title: Post Indus treaty hold, India triggers untimely water release from J&K dams
content: While such release of water — called ‘flushing the reservoir’ — is a routine, annual activity and necessary to clear the dams of riverine silt and muck to keep the power plants linked to these reservoirs running optimally, it is usually done in August, during the monsoon.

title: Smoke emanates from Kozhikode MCH again, patients evacuated
content: On May 2, 151 patients were shifted following after a minor explosion on the ground floor of the same building. Minister admits to lapse in readmitting patients to the building without adopting proper safety measures

title: Tight security in place for Thathayagunta Gangamma temple jatra
content: The Gangamma Jatara, is known for its vibrant and unique traditions, has gained attention across India after the Telugu film ‘Pushpa – The Rule’

title: 500 homestays identified in tribal, heritage, rural areas as part of sustainable tourism initiatives in A.P.
content: The move is a part of the State’s vision to empower local communities while celebrating its rich cultural, tribal, and ecological identity, says Tourism Department

title: A dream come true for tribal families in Amboori as Kumbichal Kadavu bridge becomes a reality
content: 1,450 families living in the tribal settlements in Thodumala and surrounding areas to benefit from bridge completed at ₹24.71 crore from KIIFB funds

title: Government, online companies spar in Supreme Court on GST over games of skill, chance
content: Centre contends that betting or wagering on any kind of game, whether chance or skill-based, is gambling

title: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy urges employee unions to understand the poor finances left behind by the BRS
content: Who Are You Fighting?, CM questioned Unions, highlights ₹30,000 crore support to farmers in 16 months

title: Viksit Kerala key to achieving Viksit Bharat: Governor
content: Governor presents Business Excellence Awards 2025 instituted by Trivandrum Chamber of Commerce and Industry

title: New study reveals how lion-tailed macaque strategically uses its habitat amidst increasing human pressures
content: A study of two lion-tailed macaque troops, one in buffer zone and another in the core zone of the National Park, showed different behavioural patterns

title: Bengal LoP offers ‘safe house’ to family members of Murshidabad lynching victims
content: This comes after the family alleged that police broke open the doors and barged into their premises in Kolkata, where they had come to file a petition before the Calcutta High Court demanding a CBI probe into the murder of two of their family members.

title: Prakasam police bust notorious inter-district gang of thieves
content: The police officials have arrested three thieves and recovered ₹85 lakh worth gold and silver ornaments, 6 kg marijuana and a car from them

title: Rajeev Chandrasekhar wangled an official invitation to Vizhinjam port commissioning: Govindan
content: CPI(M) plans many programmes on June 29, the 50th anniversary of Emergency, to honour those who resisted the Congress government’s constitutional overreach

title: SC survey: Hassan Deputy Commissioner appeals to public to cooperate
content: District administration has appointed 1,968 enumerators, one each for every 150 households, and they will make door-to-door visits to collect data on a mobile app, says DC Sathyabhama

title: Mango farmers in NTR district face losses as pest attack, unseasonal rains hit yield
content: Three episodes of unseasonal rains in the first two weeks of April, the harvesting time, resulted in heavy fruit damage and drop, say ryots

title: Harvested paddy procurement to be completed in 2 days, says Minister
content: 60,374 metric tonne of second crop procured from 24,969 farmers in the district. In the first crop, the total paddy procured was 74,348 metric tonne from 33,792 farmers

title: Will provide 20 lakh jobs by setting up industries: Bharath
content: The Industries and Commerce Minister, along with Panyam MLA Gouru Charitha Reddy, district Collector P. Ranjith Basha and others, inaugurates the ₹38.47 crore MSME park set up at Guttapadu village in Orvakal mandal

title: Thrissur Pooram declared open with Vilambaram ritual
content: Neythalakavilamma arrives at the Vadakkunnathan temple, Thekke Gopura Nada opens with ritualistic splendour

title: Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar urges youth to become environment protection warriors
content: He participates in a special interaction programme with faculty members and students at the College of Forestry in Sirsi of Uttara Kannada

title: Tunnel road project: Kerala to provide clarifications to EAC in a week
content: The EAC on infrastructure projects of the Ministry of Environment has cited the proximity of the project areas to the ecologically fragile regions

title: YSRCP alleges ₹11,000 crore scam in PPA with Axis Energy
content: The agreement to procure 400 MW a year for 25 years will cause an additional burden on the exchequer, says Gudivada Amarnath

title: Mild tremors cause panic in Telangana’s Karimnagar district
content: Residents in various parts of Karimnagar, Ramadugu, Choppandandi and several other mandals in Karimnagar district reported experiencing light tremors for two seconds

title: Four journalists sent on 14-day judicial remand in Kavali
content: FIR filed in 2020 against an ex-MLA, his four followers and seven journalists, in a case related case to destroying a pylon inaugurated by then TDP general secretary Nara Lokesh in Kavali in 2018

title: Kerala’s first tribal panchayat gets a ‘smart’ panchayat office
content: Earlier, the residents of Edamalakkudy had to travel 35 km to Devikulam to avail themselves of various services. The renovated office with K-Smart facility at Societykudy is expected to simplify the process

title: Madhu Bangarappa welcomes Centre’s move to hold caste census
content: Caste enumeration is crucial as socio-economic and educational backwardness have direct links with caste, says the School Education Minister

title: Construction workers threaten protest outside Labour Minister’s residence
content: They say that though the Minister assured them of fulfilling their demands, none has been taken into consideration

title: Akshaya Centre staffer held on charge of forging NEET hall ticket
content: Greeshma, who was tasked by the student’s mother to apply for NEET for her son, forged the admit card after she forgot to apply for the exam

title: Andhra Pradesh government inks MoU with Schneider Electric India Foundation to train youth for jobs in electronics and construction
content: As part of the MoU, 20 advanced training labs will be established in government Industrial Training Institutes, polytechnic colleges, and NAC training centres between April 2024 and March 2027, say officials

title: Illuminated pandals steal the spotlight at Thrissur Pooram
content: These glowing marvels, erected at Naduvilal, Naikkanal, and Manikandanal, dazzled onlookers with their sheer height, intricate design, and digital brilliance.

title: Fire breaks out on Ujjain Mahakaleshwar temple premises; no injuries reported
content: Fire started in a room of the Madhya Pradesh Pollution Control Board; short circuit believed to be the cause

title: Air-conditioned helmets for Traffic Police in Kalaburagi
content: These distinctively designed AC helmets can effectively operate for up to 8 hours on a single full charge

title: RSS-BJP publicly denied the idea of caste census: Surjewala
content: The Congress leader claimed that Modi government also refused to release the report of caste census initiated by the Congress-UPA government in the year 2011 and threw its report in the dustbin

title: Amaravati is on course to becoming a world-class city, says PIB former DG Rajeev Jain
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu has been pro-actively engaging with a host of Central Ministries to facilitate construction of the greenfield capital city, he says

title: Excise arrests cinematographer Sameer Thahir, released on bail
content: In connection with the incident in which directors Khalid Rahman and Ashraf Hamsa were nabbed from his apartment in Kochi with 1.5 g of suspected hybrid ganja

title: CPI(M) perceives new battle lines emerging in Congress over ‘bid’ to replace K. Sudhakaran
content: Sudhakaran had said that he sensed a conspiracy by a group within the party to relegate him to a corner and push him into political irrelevance. CPI(M) said  public averments underscored that the Congress in Kerala remained deeply divided and faction-ridden, notwithstanding the national leadership’s claims of unity.

title: Centre conducting caste census due to political pressure, says APCC chief Sharmila
content: Calling that the exercise be done in a time-bound manner, the Congress leader asks the government to follow the format followed in Telangana for the purpose

title: AI: is India falling behind?
content: The success of DeepSeek in China has kindled hopes of creating a home-grown LLM; policymakers have cited India’s low-cost advances in space exploration as an example of the potential to find a similar breakthrough in AI, but the road ahead is an uphill climb

title: Joshi says the highest number of communal crimes has happened under Congress rule
content: The Minister has said that under Congress rule, a section of society resorts to such crimes as it feels the govt. will provide protection

title: Countrywide mock-drills from May 7 to prepare people for ‘external threats’
content: This comes in the backdrop of the escalating tensions between India and Pakistan in the wake of the terrorist attack in Pahalgam on April 22. The drills include operationalising air-raid warning signs, crash blackout measures, camouflaging vital installations and evacuation plans

title: Caste census will undo injustice done to BCs by Congress party, says BJP leader
content: It will help in protecting the rights of the BCs, who constitute up to 60% of the population, says Rajya Sabha member Paka Satyanarayana

title: Erakudi PHC lacks basic infrastructure, residents demand ambulance and staff support
content: There is only one staff nurse and two doctors posted at the PHC, which lacks a compound wall, making it vulnerable to anti-social elements at night

title: BJP likens Congress and its allies to a ‘fifth column’ over ‘reprehensible’ remarks on Pahalgam terror attack
content: The term refers to internal saboteurs during the Spanish Civil War; the party alleged that remarks made by Opposition leaders went against the country and were detrimental to the morale of the defence forces

title: 2026 recruiting class top 25 rankings: USC bolsters its impressive class
content: it has been nearly a decade since the Buckeyes have signed a top-five class . the Trojans have yet to make an appearance in the college football playoff . it is anchored by two five-star recruits, both of whom have come on board .

title: ⚾ One change needed for every MLB team
content: Xavier Scruggs explains why the Cubs might need to be worried about their pitching . every team, no matter how splendid or how dreadful the start, has something to change . the national league looked top-heavy, and the overall dynamic is very much one of dominance .

title: How Liverpool move on from Alexander-Arnold
content: mark Ogden wonders if Trent Alexander-Arnold's best chance of success on the pitch is at Liverpool . the 26-year-old has announced he will leave the club when his contract expires at the end of the season . he revealed he feels like he needs a new change and a challenge for him as a player .

title: Kings GM Blake out after another 1st-round exit
content: the team's general manager and vice president of hockey operations will not bring back Rob Blake after a fourth-straight playoff exit . the 55-year-old was elevated to the job in April 2017 after having served as assistant general manager under Dean Lombardi . in eight seasons as GM, Blake's teams made the Stanley Cup Playoffs five times .

title: Fans vote ex-WR Edelman into Pats Hall of Fame
content: a 2025 inductee in the Patriots Hall of Fame was voted by fans . he was a seventh-round pick out of Kent State in 2009 . his first year of eligibility was for the hall of fame .

title: Stanley Cup playoff picks: Who wins every second-round series?
content: the first round of the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs is complete . eight of the teams that made the postseason bracket have moved on, and eight others have been eliminated . ESPN's experts have identified their picks for each matchup .

title: A .423 average? Better advanced stats than Bonds!? Aaron Judge is putting up video game numbers
content: Aaron Judge is hitting an astounding .423/.510/.777 with 10 extra-base hits during his eighth-inning double Sunday . he leads the majors in batting average, on-base percentage, slugging percentage, OPS and hits .

title: This time at UCF, Scott Frost won't need to catch lightning in a bottle
content: Scott Frost is reuniting with the UCF Knights as their new head coach . the Knights are now in a power 4 conference, and there is now a 12-team college football playoff . he is a new coach at the university of central Florida .

title: NWSL: Orlando Pride top, Naeher makes history
content: a week of NWSL action is in the books, which means it's time for ESPN's Power Rankings . our writers studied the action from across Matchday 7 to come up with this week's order of all 14 teams in the league .

title: Joke row: SC summons Samay Raina, 4 others for 'mocking' the disabled

title: College baseball Week 12: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: Coastal Carolina jumped up five spots, making room for the USC Trojans to be ranked for the first time this season . the longhorns were swept on the road by Arkansas, and the Tigers dropped six sports to no. 9 . they remain no. 1 for another week .

title: India demands Asian Development Bank cut funding for Pakistan

title: NBA playoff odds: Pacers close gap on Cavaliers after Game 1 win
content: defending champions Boston Celtics and the new york Knicks are favorites to win the Eastern Conference . early favorites for Finals MVP include Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Jayson Tatum and Donovan Mitchell . the Golden State Warriors beat the Houston Rockets on the road in Game 7 .

title: How does the NHL draft lottery work? Everything you need to know
content: the no. 1 pick doesn't go to the team with the worst regular-season record . a lottery will determine the final order of the first 16 picks . the lottery gives multiple non-playoff teams the chance at getting the No.1 pick .
